text: I've not taken a detailed look at it really but are the horse market volumes up since racing resumed after lockdown? I know US market volume was up when UK racing was suspended and dropped off again after resumption but I've not looked at direct comparison of UK volume pre/post suspension? Anyone have rough numbers?

elements.text: I've not taken a detailed look at it really but are the horse market volumes up since racing resumed after lockdown? Anyone have rough numbers?

text: I haven't looked at it - it's not such an easy comparison to make because it's not like for like. For all that's said about volume I haven't found that it generally correlates to profit in my case. I'm quite happy betting on lower volume markets. I'm not pretending to know why the CV markets have been so good but they have been just amazing - certainly as far as IR horses goes. I'm sure others will agree.

text: I reckon tennis results are a bit all over the shop due to Covid-19. So having a model based on past results is not likely to be as good, if you are straight betting based on your own probabilities (or maybe you pick specific matches, in which case you may be thriving). US Open women's runner-up going out in the second round of the French Open. World #1 Djokovic having his worst ever career loss, a lot of the top players not even competing, etc

elements.text: US presidential market is completely insane:

text: It should have been settled by now

elements.text: It should have been settled by now

text:
in the rules:

If there is any material change to the established role or any ambiguity as to who occupies the position, then Betfair may determine, using its reasonable discretion, how to settle the market based on all the information available to it at the relevant time. Betfair reserves the right to wait for further official announcements before the market is settled.

elements.text:
